laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 3800 per cubic millimeter (reference range, 4500 to 11,000); the rest of the complete blood count and differential count were normal.
Blood levels of electrolytes, glucose, total protein, albumin, and globulin tests were all normal.
Showed no evidence of metastatic disease.

Marked enlargement of the right breast and thickening of the overlying skin, small right axillary lymph nodes (<1 cm in diameter), and a nonspecific nodule (2 mm in diameter) in the lower lobe of the left lung.
Revealed multiple solid hepatic lesions (â‰¤1.6 cm in diameter), which were thought to be metastases.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT Scan of the Abdomen After Treatment
laboratory_examinations.date: One year after the initiation of treatment
laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed resolution of all hepatic lesions, with the exception of a single lesion in the left lobe.

laboratory_examinations.date: One year after the initiation of treatment
laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed an irregular area of enhancement, up to 5.4 cm in greatest dimension, extending from the upper outer quadrant to the upper inner quadrant of the right breast.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Enhanced area reflects combination of residual tumor and inflammatory response to neoadjuvant therapy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed foci of residual invasive ductal carcinoma, grade 3 of 3, spanning an area of at least 2.5 cm, and extensive ductal carcinoma in situ, grade 3 of 3.
